column5: Hello gang,  I got a bit of an odd issue (no...no embarrassing rashes or funny welts....lol)....  Once the power returns after an outage in my neighbourhood.....my flippin' garage door opens!!  Can anyone "esplain" why?  Do I need a new motor and use the old one as an anchor?  Thanks,  Meely
Mine would do the same, but mine was also ancient, I ended up just disconnecting it because my tenants are too dumb to look before opening or closing the door
Mine will do that if there is a lightning storm and the power flickers. I'd like to know the solution too!
dang, I need to see  if mine does that  UPS would fix it short term
Guess none of you guys have alarm systems... can't imagine the false alarms.
Electonic board in the opener can be finicky, Plugging it in a good surge protector might help, you can try calling the menufecturer, they might have a fix for that issue.

Hello gang,  I got a bit of an odd issue (no...no embarrassing rashes or funny welts....lol)....  Once the power returns after an outage in my neighbourhood.....my flippin' garage door opens!!  Can anyone "esplain" why?  Do I need a new motor and use the old one as an anchor?  Thanks,  Meely   Maybe it is The Ghost of Meely Manor playing tricks on you...
